intro: Oxyanthus racemosus, commonly known as the racemose oxyanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit and the presence of opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, which are borne along the stems. Its fruits are small berries that contain several seeds. Oxyanthus racemosus is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments.
